results.title: Magic lantern set effects slide (La tarte aux oiseaux - the bird pie)
results.brief_description: Hand painted magic lantern set effects slide with wooden frame. A man smiles holding a large pie - by sliding the effects slide, a three birds fly out of the pie and his smile turns in to a frown. Black tape has been adhered to the edge of the sliding section.
results.title_for_label: Magic lantern set effects slide (La tarte aux oiseaux - the bird pie)
results.description: Hand painted magic lantern set effects slide with wooden frame. A man smiles holding a large pie - by sliding the effects slide, a three birds fly out of the pie and his smile turns in to a frown. Black tape has been adhered to the edge of the sliding section.

results.title: Magic lantern set effects slide (Les jouers de cartes - the card players)
results.brief_description: Hand painted magic lantern set effects slipping slide in wooden frame [Les Jouers de Cartes - the Card Players]. By sliding the effects slide, two card players’ heads turn in to a chicken (left) and a dog (right).
results.title_for_label: Magic lantern set effects slide (Les jouers de cartes - the card players)
results.description: Hand painted magic lantern set effects slipping slide in wooden frame [Les Jouers de Cartes - the Card Players]. By sliding the effects slide, two card players’ heads turn in to a chicken (left) and a dog (right).

results.title: Magic lantern slipping slide (Le nez d'arlequin - the harlequin's nose)
results.brief_description: Hand painted magic lantern slipping slide ‘Le Nez d’Arlequin’ -‘ The Harlequin’s Nose’ or ‘Punch with Long Nose’ with wooden frame. Manufactured by E.Mazo, Paris. By moving the slipping slide, a harlequin’s nose grows longer and three small children appear on the tip. The words ‘Punch’s Long Nose’ is etched vertically in to the glass plate.
results.title_for_label: Magic lantern slipping slide (Le nez d’arlequin - the harlequin’s nose)
results.description: Hand painted magic lantern slipping slide ‘Le Nez d’Arlequin’ -‘ The Harlequin’s Nose’ or ‘Punch with Long Nose’ with wooden frame. Manufactured by E.Mazo, Paris. By moving the slipping slide, a harlequin’s nose grows longer and three small children appear on the tip. The words ‘Punch’s Long Nose’ is etched vertically in to the glass plate.

results.title: Magic lantern set effects slide (Dentist pulling a tooth)
results.brief_description: Hand painted magic lantern set effects slipping slide in wooden frame (dentist pulling a tooth). As the slipping slide is pulled, a dentist pulls out a tooth from a patient.

results.title: Magic lantern set effects slide (Man and lions)
results.brief_description: Magic lantern set effects slide with wooden frame. By sliding the effects slide, a man fights between two lions set against a black background. Made by Lawler, 161 Strand, London. ‘91’ written in pencil on wooden frame. Cream tape has been adhered to the edge of the sliding section.

results.title: [Agnotes Advertisement: 1]
results.brief_description:
Victoria’s Department of Agriculture (now Agriculture Victoria) produced Agnotes, a series of reference material for the industry with the aim to disseminate expert advise for best agricultural practices.

This advertisement was designed to increase the uptake of the Agnotes by farmers. It is one of many commercials produced for the Department of Agriculture.

results.title: [Wallace Clarke Home Movies: Reel 27]
results.brief_description:
Wallace Clarke was an amateur filmmaker who was particularly keen on capturing the Australian landscape from the 1960s to the 1990s. As well as Australian urban settings and some world travels, Wallace’s films focus on the many hiking and camping destinations that he visited.

Often carrying the credit, ‘A Walkabout Film’, Wallace’s movies indicate that he was part of a nature study and walking group called ‘The Walkabouters Club of Victoria Inc’. The ‘Walkabouters’ formed in 1968 as a result of a Council of Adult Education (CAE), Outback Study Tour to Central Australia. Some of the attendees decided to start the Club in order to continue educative walks particularly around Victoria. The Club encouraged their resident artists and photographers to capture their activities.

The collection of Wallace’s films was donated to ACMI by his widow Gwenda Clarke and is shot on various formats, predominantly Standard 8mm and Super 8mm film.

In this film the ‘Walkabouters’ go to Werribee Gorge State Park in Victoria for one of their walks. On this visit, they see spiders, flowers and fungi, look for rock samples and do some fence making and tree planting.

A particular point of interest is an early Coolabah brand wine cask. Established in 1962, Orlando Coolabah was one of the first commercially successful cask wine brands in Australia and very popular in the 1970s. The wine cask itself was invented and perfected in Australia, initially by Angoves Wines in South Australia.

This film also shows some mushrooms and the practice of ‘mushrooming’ in grassy farm paddocks, equipped with buckets and knives.

Originally made on Super 8mm film.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:34:00 close-up of a moth on a leaf
00:00:38:00 large mushrooms in a grassy paddock
00:00:46:00 a woman slicing the mushrooms from the ground and collecting in a bucket
00:01:07:00 a largish spider runs up a canvas tent wall and the underside of a mushroom
00:01:22:00 peeling a large mushroom
00:01:52:00 a Coolabah brand wine cask and a poodle dog, mushrooms cooked on a camp stove
00:02:10:00 climbing over a stile in a fence
00:02:53:00 hikers climbing and helping each other over a rocky part of the trail
00:03:07:00 close-up of a spider in its web
00:04:07:00 descending a steep rock face
00:05:49:00 a iridescent blue and green beetle, tree lichen and a brown spider in its web
00:06:09:00 perfect light brown mushroom soon followed by another species of mushroom
00:06:54:00 several spiders on their webs
00:07:42:00 a variety of leather mushrooms
00:08:30:00 likely Ambicodamus crinitus spider
00:09:13:00 sign ‘Werribee Gorge’
00:09:30:00 hikers group sitting on the edge of a rocky cliff looking at the view, including a woman with binoculars
00:11:18:00 koala in close-up and and then climbing a tree
00:11:40:00 soaring Australian wedge-tailed eagle
00:12:07:00 group of (likely) bombadier beetles in green leaves
00:12:52:00 crossing the creek rock by rock
00:13:05:00 a small brown frog (likely litoria paraewingi)
00:13:12:00 hikers take a break - cameras, snacks and beer
00:15:02:00 overlooking tents at the camping site
00:15:17:00 wading the creek and a hiker rests with his dog on a hillside
00:15:55:00 leaf impressions on the rocks
00:16:36:00 1970s style cars - station wagons and camping van
00:16:55:00 two men using a manual post hole digger followed by scenes of fence making
00:17:29:00 planting new trees

results.title: Hello, Mr. Webb!
results.brief_description: Film made by the Department of Agriculture’s film unit to promote itself by showing who they are, where they are located and what they do on a daily basis. The tone of the piece is very light and it contains numerous jokes relating to the fact that it is the film unit making a film about the film unit. Also contains general information about film editing machines (Moviola) and how they operate. Brief footage of the Spring St end of Bourke street circa 1977.

results.title: A Working holiday
results.creator_credit: Jack Keane and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: Hop picking in Victoria; seasonal workers gather from all parts of Australia for six weeks to harvest hops in the rich Ovens Valley. Shows the picking, bagging and weighing of the bags, and transport to the kilns. The weekend break is spent swimming, fishing or sight-seeing in the surrounding Alps.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack Keane and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.description: Hop picking in Victoria; seasonal workers gather from all parts of Australia for six weeks to harvest hops in the rich Ovens Valley. Shows the picking, bagging and weighing of the bags, and transport to the kilns. The weekend break is spent swimming, fishing or sight-seeing in the surrounding Alps.
description_for_label: Hop picking in Victoria; seasonal workers gather from all parts of Australia for six weeks to harvest hops in the rich Ovens Valley. Shows the picking, bagging and weighing of the bags, and transport to the kilns. The weekend break is spent swimming, fishing or sight-seeing in the surrounding Alps.

results.title: Goodness - it's milk!
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture. Film Unit
results.brief_description:
This short film, produced by the Victorian Department of Agriculture, promotes the dairy industry by proclaiming the benefits of drinking milk.

The film opens with some lovely footage of a couple exploring the Blue Dandenongs, including a milkbar with signs for ‘Peter’s Ice-Cream’, ‘Herald’, and ‘Four ‘n’ Twenty Pies’, where they order two tall glasses of milk.

The film then shows scenes of schoolchildren, a patient and nurse in a hospital and a domestic kitchen, while the narrator describes the health benefits of milk. The film finishes with footage of the dairy industry, from the farm to industrial pasteurising and bottling processes, and finally home delivery.
